comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Grandson of this William Weightman: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Weightman Nephew of Anne Weightman Walker Penfield: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3640755505/]

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See New York Times, August 12, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9907E7DC1730E233A... "Weightman Quietly Takes a Bride Here. Great-grandson of Manufacturer Who Left $100,000,000 Married to Miss Mary Powers." "man only 7/2/26" written on the negative presumably relates to a later use of the image. According to NYT, July 10, 1926, select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0C1EF739551B7A... "PHILADELPHIA, July 9. -- William Weightman 3d, the three times married and once divorced member of a wealthy Philadelphia family, was on his way to Auburn Prison today to surrender as a violator of his parole."

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started a biography of him in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Weightman_III
